title: backward pass different behaviors with inplace operation
body_html:
Issue description

Strange behaviour with inplace operation in the backward pass

Code example

Using sigmoid function and then inplace operation raises the error on backward pass

>>> a = torch.tensor([1,2,3.], requires_grad = True)
>>> b = a.sigmoid()
>>> b
tensor([ 0.7311,  0.8808,  0.9526])
>>> b[1]= 2
>>> b.sum().backward()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 93, in backward
    torch.autograd.backward(self, gradient, retain_graph, create_graph)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/autograd/__init__.py", line 89, in backward
    allow_unreachable=True)  # allow_unreachable flag
RuntimeError: one of the variables needed for gradient computation has been modified by an inplace operation

inplace operation here does not raise the error on backward pass:

>>> a = torch.tensor([1,2,3.], requires_grad = True)
>>> b = 1/((-a).exp()+1)
>>> b
tensor([ 0.7311,  0.8808,  0.9526])
>>> b[1]= 2
>>> b.sum().backward()
>>> a.grad
tensor([ 0.1966,  0.0000,  0.0452])

System Info

PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 8.0.61

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.10) 5.4.0 20160609

/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.0.5

## Issue description
Strange behaviour with inplace operation in the backward pass

## Code example

Using sigmoid function and then inplace operation raises the error on backward pass

```
>>> a = torch.tensor([1,2,3.], requires_grad = True)
>>> b = a.sigmoid()
>>> b
tensor([ 0.7311,  0.8808,  0.9526])
>>> b[1]= 2
>>> b.sum().backward()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 93, in backward
    torch.autograd.backward(self, gradient, retain_graph, create_graph)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/autograd/__init__.py", line 89, in backward
    allow_unreachable=True)  # allow_unreachable flag
RuntimeError: one of the variables needed for gradient computation has been modified by an inplace operation

```

inplace operation here does not raise the error on backward pass:

```
>>> a = torch.tensor([1,2,3.], requires_grad = True)
>>> b = 1/((-a).exp()+1)
>>> b
tensor([ 0.7311,  0.8808,  0.9526])
>>> b[1]= 2
>>> b.sum().backward()
>>> a.grad
tensor([ 0.1966,  0.0000,  0.0452])
```
